articles.description:
Proposed federal cuts could blow a multi-billion-dollar hole in the state’s budget Oregon is in a better financial position than other states but could see its budget devastated by federal spending cuts, a framework released Wednesday by the Legislature’s top budget writers shows.  The framework, an early step toward adopting the state’s next two-year budget,…

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
Oregon needs to build about 29,500 more homes each year, mostly in the Portland region and Willamette Valley, to emerge from a housing shortage years in the making, the state’s chief economist told lawmakers Monday.  The state’s Office of Economic Analysis recently released its first annual housing needs analysis report, with homebuilding targets for the state and…
The post Oregon needs to build 29,500 more homes each year, chief economist says appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: Oregon needs to build 29,500 more homes each year, chief economist says

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
Oregon’s unemployment rate was 4.4% in January and 4.3%, as revised, in December, after rising gradually over the past year from 4.1% in January 2024. Oregon’s 4.4% unemployment rate was the highest since September 2021, when the rate was also 4.4%. The U.S. unemployment rate was 4.1% in December 2024 and 4.0% in January 2025.…
The post Oregon’s Unemployment Rate Rises to 4.4% in January appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
